thread.title: William Hill to sell Australia business to CrownBet unit

title: William Hill to sell Australia business to CrownBet unit
text: March 6, 2018 / 7:27 AM / in 19 minutes William Hill to sell Australia business to CrownBet unit Reuters Staff 1 Min Read (Reuters) - British bookmaker William Hill Plc said it agreed to sell its Australia business to a unit of CrownBet for an equity value of A$313.7 million (175.9 million pounds). FILE PHOTO: A branded sign is displayed outside a William Hill betting shop in London, Britain July 25, 2016. REUTERS/Neil Hall/File Photo The deal represents an enterprise value of A$300 million, the company said. William Hill said in February that it could pull out of Australia, where it has around 284,000 customers, after booking exceptional charges on operations. Reporting by Arathy S Nair in Bengaluru; Editing by Gopakumar Warrier
